result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin M Weyrough was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
 plus $75 drug testing fee; the drug testing fee amount is joint and several with the Co-Defendant

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations of treatment per the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to submit to random urinalyses as the deemed to be necessary and appropriate by the Agent
--no contact with Edward Wilging
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent 
--to maintain employment and/or educational programming as approved by the Agent

The Court authorizes Mr. Weyrough to petition for expungement of this case under Statute 973.015. 

Arresting Agency: UWPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

case called at 11:18am. [MK]
Defendant Austin M Weyrough in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On Motion of the State, the Court amends the charge in Count #1 to an Unclassified Misdemeanor Possession of THC contrary to Statute  961.41(3g)(e).

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1, #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Weyrough guilty of both counts, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On both Count #1 and Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Weyrough on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations of treatment per the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to submit to random urinalyses as the deemed to be necessary and appropriate by the Agent
--no contact with Edward Wilging
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent 
--to maintain employment and/or educational programming as approved by the Agent
--On Count #1:  to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $75 drug testing fee; the drug testing fee amount is joint and several with the Co-Defendant  
--On Count #2:  to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court authorizes Mr. Weyrough to petition for expungement of this case under Statute 973.015.  The Court clarifies to Mr. Weyrough that he will need to obtain the discharge certificate from the Probation authorities and then file that along with his petition for expungement. Once this is filed, the Court will schedule a hearing.
